verses.verse: At this <S%H2063><s%> also my heart <S%H3820><s%> trembleth <S%H2729><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and is moved out <S%H5425><s%> <S%H8799><s%> of his place <S%H4725><s%>.

Hear <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8798><s%> attentively <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8800><s%> the noise <S%H7267><s%> of his voice <S%H6963><s%>, and the sound <S%H1899><s%> that goeth out <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8799><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%>.
He directeth <S%H3474><s%> <S%H8765><s%> it <S%H8281><s%> <S%H8799><s%> under the whole heaven <S%H8064><s%>, and his lightning <S%H216><s%> unto the ends <S%H3671><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>.

After <S%H310><s%> it a voice <S%H6963><s%> roareth <S%H7580><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: he thundereth <S%H7481><s%> <S%H8686><s%> with the voice <S%H6963><s%> of his excellency <S%H1347><s%>; and he will not stay <S%H6117><s%> <S%H8762><s%> them when his voice <S%H6963><s%> is heard <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8735><s%>.

'Elohim <S%H410><s%> thundereth <S%H7481><s%> <S%H8686><s%> marvellously <S%H6381><s%> <S%H8737><s%> with his voice <S%H6963><s%>; great things <S%H1419><s%> doeth <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8802><s%> he, which we cannot comprehend <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.

For he saith <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to the snow <S%H7950><s%>, Be thou <S%H1933><s%> <S%H8798><s%> on the earth <S%H776><s%>; likewise to the small <S%H4306><s%> rain <S%H1653><s%>, and to the great <S%H4306><s%> rain <S%H1653><s%> of his strength <S%H5797><s%>.
He sealeth up <S%H2856><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the hand <S%H3027><s%> of every man <S%H120><s%>; that all men <S%H582><s%> may know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8800><s%> his work <S%H4639><s%>.
Then the beasts <S%H2416><s%> go <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> into <S%H1119><s%> dens <S%H695><s%>, and remain <S%H7931><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in their places <S%H4585><s%>.
Out of the south <S%H2315><s%> cometh <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the whirlwind <S%H5492><s%>: and cold <S%H7135><s%> out of the north <S%H4215><s%>.
By the breath <S%H5397><s%> of 'Elohim <S%H410><s%> frost <S%H7140><s%> is given <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: and the breadth <S%H7341><s%> of the waters <S%H4325><s%> is straitened <S%H4164><s%>.
Also by watering <S%H7377><s%> he wearieth <S%H2959><s%> <S%H8686><s%> the thick cloud <S%H5645><s%>: he scattereth <S%H6327><s%> <S%H8686><s%> his bright <S%H216><s%> cloud <S%H6051><s%>:

And it is turned <S%H2015><s%> <S%H8693><s%> round about <S%H4524><s%> by his counsels <S%H8458><s%>: that they may do <S%H6467><s%> whatsoever he commandeth <S%H6680><s%> <S%H8762><s%> them upon the face <S%H6440><s%> of the world <S%H8398><s%> in the earth <S%H776><s%>.
He causeht it to come <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, whether for correction <S%H7626><s%>, or for his land <S%H776><s%>, or for mercy <S%H2617><s%>.

Hearken <S%H238><s%> <S%H8685><s%> unto this, O I-yov <S%H347><s%>: stand still <S%H5975><s%> <S%H8798><s%>, and consider <S%H995><s%> <S%H8708><s%> the wondrous <S%H6381><s%> <S%H8737><s%> works of 'Elohim <S%H410><s%>.

Dost thou know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%> when 'Elohim <S%H433><s%> disposed <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8800><s%> them, and caused the light <S%H216><s%> of his cloud <S%H6051><s%> to shine <S%H3313><s%> <S%H8689><s%> ?

Dost thou know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the balancings <S%H4657><s%> of the clouds <S%H5645><s%>, the wondrous works <S%H4652><s%> of him which is perfect <S%H8549><s%> in knowledge <S%H1843><s%> ?
How thy garments <S%H899><s%> are warm <S%H2525><s%>, when he quieteth <S%H8252><s%> <S%H8687><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> by the south <S%H1864><s%> wind ?
Hast thou with him spread out <S%H7554><s%> <S%H8686><s%> the sky <S%H7834><s%>, which is strong <S%H2389><s%>, and as a molten <S%H3332><s%> <S%H8716><s%> looking glass <S%H7209><s%> ?

Teach <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8685><s%> us what we shall say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto him; for we cannot order <S%H6186><s%> <S%H8799><s%> our speech by reason <S%H6440><s%> of darkness <S%H2822><s%>.

Shall it be told <S%H5608><s%> <S%H8792><s%> him that I speak <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8762><s%>? if a man <S%H376><s%> speak <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, surely he shall be swallowed up <S%H1104><s%> <S%H8792><s%>.

And now men see <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8804><s%> not the bright <S%H925><s%> light <S%H216><s%> which is in the clouds <S%H7834><s%>: but the wind <S%H7307><s%> passeht <S%H5674><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, and cleanseht <S%H2891><s%> <S%H8762><s%> them.
Fair weather <S%H2091><s%> cometh <S%H857><s%> <S%H8799><s%> out of the north <S%H6828><s%>: with 'Elohim <S%H433><s%> is terrible <S%H3372><s%> <S%H8737><s%> majesty <S%H1935><s%>.

Touching 'El SHaddai <S%H7706><s%>, we cannot find him out <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8804><s%>: he is excellent <S%H7689><s%> in power <S%H3581><s%>, and in judgment <S%H4941><s%>, and in plenty <S%H7230><s%> of justice <S%H6666><s%>: he will not afflict <S%H6031><s%> <S%H8762><s%>.
Men <S%H582><s%> do therefore fear <S%H3372><s%> <S%H8804><s%> him: he respecteth <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not any that are wise <S%H2450><s%> of heart <S%H3820><s%>.
